title: MS LAGG ISSUES
body:
Hi this is my second post about this i had someone help me the last time but its not fixed.

My issue is i will be playing in game and my "ping" ms go from 20~ to around 300-500~ making my champion and others "freeze" the whole game just freezes.

What i have done so far.. (im good with computers but know little about the connection side of things) (my FPS is fine lowest of 40 mostly at 60) 

to help myself i have contacted my ISP they said they see nothing wrong from their end i have HARD reset my router multiple times, Flushed DNS (dunno what that does) and ran a few Tracer tests and i see some packet loss. 

this ONLY happens on League of legends since around the start of Season 6. i have played on a Wireless connection since season 3.

Any help is greatly appreciated

replies.body:
Just to eliminate wireless as the problem, is it possible for you to play on a wired connection? If not, how close are you to the router?

Do you have a 5GHz or a 2.4GHz wireless modem? The difference there is that 5GHz tends to be more stable (but has less range) because fewer devices are on that band. Happy to help out once I have a little more info :)

i will try to play on a wired connection tomorrow when i can, just strange that its only just happened after playing on Wireless for a few years, ive changed my router once but not had any problems with either

It's possible that some other new device in your home is interfering with the router's signal or making you drop packets & lag. This is just an easy first step to "prove" it's an issue with wireless; if the same issues are happening on wired it would be a totally different troubleshooting path.

Let me know how it goes on wired! In the meantime, if you can also give me your router make & model as well as the wireless adapter you use for your PC that would get a head start on next steps.

dear riot,

same problem for me since 6.1 (this somehow always happens at season starts) 
i play a custom game with a friend against 5 bots, everything is fine.
the moment i start a normal/aram my ping goes up to 8k and i dc all the time.

no problems in other games :/ no problems in season 5 or the preseason.

I'm sorry to hear you're having connection troubles too :(

Would you mind letting me know if you play on wireless or wired as well?
i play on wireless but i tried to use a wire. sadly didnt fix it :/

Hm, okay. I would recommend going with Deep Terror Nami's steps below so we can look deeper into what might be causing the connection problem -- please just post a screenshot of the traceroute as that will help greatly with looking at where the connection is going wrong.

In case you need info on how to run a traceroute, we have an article up here: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2

http://puu.sh/n4DgT/a3f0d8ea95.png

its german but there arent really any parts that are german.
hope that helps

I'm sorry, but I didn't notice at first that you're on EUW. You were actually tracing the route to the NA servers.

Could you please post again but use this IP instead (this is EUW server: 185.40.65.1)

Thanks, and sorry about the mix up!
http://puu.sh/n5G8Z/2accda6189.png here you go and no problem :D
Hey, sorry for the delay in getting back with you here. Do you use Telia as your ISP? It looks like as soon as you hit Telia servers with your connection there is a lot of timeouts going on.
hm my isp is telekom austria, i never used telia. thats weird

Hm, very odd. I'm not sure what is causing the timeouts here. If this is still ongoing for you, have you submitted a support ticket yet for further help? We may need to take a deeper dive into your connection one on one.

Can you also take a quick look for me.. i am having the same issue.


Tracing route to 104.160.131.1 over a maximum of 30 hops

  1    <1 ms    <1 ms     1 ms  10.0.0.1 
  2    13 ms     8 ms    14 ms  50.173.36.1 
  3   400 ms   356 ms   369 ms  xe-0-1-2-sur01.davis.ca.ccal.comcast.net [68.87.201.17] 
  4   258 ms   288 ms   279 ms  ae-32-ar01.sacramento.ca.ccal.comcast.net [68.87.200.109] 
  5   301 ms   336 ms   282 ms  68.86.93.25 
  6   267 ms   282 ms   331 ms  be-10925-cr01.9greatoaks.ca.ibone.comcast.net [68.86.87.158] 
  7   407 ms   401 ms   306 ms  he-0-15-0-1-pe03.11greatoaks.ca.ibone.comcast.net [68.86.86.222] 
  8   406 ms   398 ms   341 ms  50.248.116.198 
  9   150 ms   199 ms   160 ms  104.160.130.35 
 10    61 ms    61 ms    62 ms  ae30-br02.chi01.riotdirect.net [104.160.159.12] 
 11   107 ms    70 ms    80 ms  ae1-br01.chi01.riotdirect.net [104.160.159.8] 
 12    97 ms   113 ms   113 ms  104.160.131.1 

Trace complete.
Do you have your ticket number handy? I can take a look there and ask for more info from you
yes i did, on the euw servers :D

Realtek RTL8188CE 802.11b/g/n WiFi Adapter

and The Router is a BT home hub not sure how to find out what it is
If you let me know which version of  BT Home Hub you have (3,4,5?) I can find out the rest of the details. Also please let me know how it goes on wired today and if that improves the situation :)
Just to let you know i don't "DC" as far as im aware it doesn't say "a summoner has disconnected or say Attempting to reconnect"

Please follow the steps (if there are any you haven't completed) on the [Connection Troubleshooting Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to make sure your connection is set up properly.

If those steps don't help, you can view your connection by running a traceroute, and sharing the results might show us where it's going wrong. I suggest downloading the [WinMTR Network Diagnostic Tool](http://winmtr.net/download-winmtr/). Use that to run a traceroute to the following IP's (allow this to run for 5-15 minutes)

> 185.40.65.1
162.249.72.1

Export the results to a text file and paste them here.
